metadata.subject: Major General Archer Lyman Durham, USAF

verification_methodology.note: Race is a critical verification field in US census records. The Durham family was African American, participants in the Great Migration from NC to CA.

birth.place: Pasadena, Los Angeles County, California, USA

death.note: No obituary found in public search as of 2026-01-21

notable_positions: Director of Deployment, US Transportation Command, MacDill AFB, Florida
military_career.awards: Maj. Gen. Archer L. Durham Award established in his honor (recognizes leadership in fostering teamwork and cultural awareness)

father.name: Barney Matthias Durham, Sr.

death.place: Pasadena, Los Angeles County, California, USA
death.source: Pasadena Star News obituary published 3/3/1972, Page A-10
death.note: CONFIRMED: Full name 'Barney Matthias Durham, Sr.' revealed in obituary index. Death date matches FindAGrave (1972), contradicts SSDI/California Death Index (1974). The 'Sr.' designation indicates he had a son named Barney Matthias Durham Jr.

burial.location: Altadena, Los Angeles County, California, USA
burial.verification_notes: CONFIRMED via Pasadena News Index obituary (3/3/1972). The 'M' stands for 'Matthias' - full name 'Barney Matthias Durham, Sr.' FindAGrave death year (1972) is CORRECT; birth year (1895) still differs from WWI draft (1892). Middle name Matthias also confirmed by 1950 Census.

father.occupation: Farm laborer (NC 1920), Community leader and musician (Pasadena)
father.migration: Great Migration from NC to CA (part of 6+ million African Americans who moved from rural South to urban North/West 1910-1970)

census_1950.verification_notes: Middle initial 'M' matches FindAGrave memorial #7935180. Confirms residence in Pasadena 10 years after 1940 Census.

father.note: FamilySearch requires authentication to view full records. NARA 1950 Census is freely accessible.

ruled_out_matches.name: Mattie Troxtel Durham
ruled_out_matches.reason: Different family - born Alabama, married James Erskin Durham, buried DeKalb County Alabama. Race not verified but family/location mismatch is conclusive.
ruled_out_matches.parents: John Patrick Troxtel & Hester Ann Love Troxtel

ruled_out_matches.name: Mattie Willingham Durham
ruled_out_matches.reason: Different family - born Texas, married Wilson Alonzo Durham 12/23/1925, children Ralph/Joseph/Wayne (none named Archer or Barbara), buried Dallas TX. Race not verified but family/location mismatch is conclusive.

ruled_out_matches.name: Barbara Lois Jones Durham
ruled_out_matches.reason: Different family - married Floyd Leland Durham (1919-1991), buried Salem Baptist Church Cemetery, Collins, Mississippi. Children: Barbara E. Durham Pepper, Floyd Leland Durham Jr. Race not verified but family/location mismatch is conclusive.

generation_0_siblings.name: Barney Matthias Durham, Jr.

birth.note: Birth year unknown; the 'Jr.' designation means he was named after his father Barney Matthias Durham, Sr.

death.source: Pasadena Star News obituary published 9/13/1997, Page A-4, Column 1

generation_0_siblings.note: NEWLY DISCOVERED sibling via Pasadena News Index obituary search. The existence of 'Jr.' was implied by father's 'Sr.' designation. Not found in 1940 Census - may have been born after 1940 or living elsewhere. Obituary full text needs retrieval from Pasadena Public Library microfilm.

grandfather.name: Archer Durham
grandfather.note: Major General Archer L. Durham was named after him. Search Freedmen's Bureau and NC records.

maternal.note: Mother Mattie Sorrell was born in Arkansas. Search AR census and vital records for Sorrell family.

research_lead.name: Mary Minerva Archer Sorrells
research_lead.significance: Has 'Archer' as middle name - suggests possible family connection between Sorrell and Archer/Durham families. The name 'Archer' appears in both paternal (grandfather Archer Durham) and possibly maternal lines.

potential.name: D. Scott Durham
potential.position: Commander, Fourth Air Force, March ARB (retired July 2025)
potential.note: Same surname and Air Force career suggests possible relation, but no direct evidence found. Hometown is Pennsylvania, not California. Race not confirmed.

verified_facts: Archer Lyman Durham born June 9, 1932 in Pasadena, CA (California Birth Index)
Father Barney Durham from Wake County, NC; migrated to California (Great Migration)
Father Barney Durham served as WWI draft registrant
Family appears in 1920 and 1940 US Census records as African American (Negro/Black)
Father Barney M. Durham found in 1950 Census - Pasadena, Los Angeles, ED 68-45, p.15 (NARA 1950 Census)
Archer L. Durham achieved rank of Major General, USAF
Award named in his honor recognizes leadership in fostering teamwork and cultural awareness
CONFIRMED: Father's full name was 'Barney Matthias Durham, Sr.' (Pasadena News Index obituary 3/3/1972)
CONFIRMED: Father Barney Durham died March 3, 1972 (Pasadena Star News obituary, Page A-10)
CONFIRMED: Father buried at Mountain View Cemetery, Altadena, CA (FindAGrave #7935180 as 'Barney M Durham' 1895-1972)
CONFIRMED: Middle initial 'M' stands for 'Matthias' (1950 Census + obituary index)
NEWLY DISCOVERED: Brother Barney Matthias Durham Jr. existed (obituary 9/13/1997 in Pasadena Star News)
unverified_claims: Mother's death date and burial location
Sister Barbara's death date and burial location

negative_search_results.note: Documenting searches with no results is important for GPS compliance

searches.note: Pre-Civil War era African Americans often lack formal burial records
Search returned suggested results for Archer (first name) and Durham (last name) separately but no 'Archer Durham' obituary

searches.result: 17 Durham records found, none matching Mattie or Barbara
searches.note: Only Barney M Durham appears to be from this family

searches.parameters: name=Archer Durham, state=CA, county=Pasadena Los Angeles
searches.result: 22 fuzzy matches returned, none are Archer L. Durham
searches.note: AI/OCR extraction returned similar names (Burham, Dunham, Archer as first name) but no exact 'Archer Durham' or 'Archer L. Durham'. Subject was 18 years old in 1950 and may have been away at college (Utah State University) or listed elsewhere.

searches.parameters: name=Mattie Durham, state=CA, county=Pasadena Los Angeles
searches.result: 93 fuzzy matches returned, ED 68-45 shows 'Durham Barney M' only
searches.note: No separate 'Mattie Durham' indexed. She may be in same household as Barney on census image but not separately extracted by AI/OCR. ED 68-45 is where Barney M. Durham was found.

searches.parameters: name=Barbara Durham, state=CA, county=Pasadena Los Angeles
searches.result: 313 fuzzy matches returned, ED 68-45 shows 'Durham Barney M' only
searches.note: No 'Barbara Durham' or 'Barbara Camille Durham' indexed. Sister was ~24 in 1950 and may have married (different surname) or moved. ED 68-45 is where Barney M. Durham was found.
Direct search for 'Archer Durham' returned zero results. Confirms no publicly published obituary exists despite reported death in 2024.

All results are from 2020s (Reginald Bernard Durham 2025, Bernard R Durham 2024, Rev. Bernard Durham 2023, etc.). Legacy.com primarily has digitized obituaries from the 2000s+. 1972-1974 death records not available via this source.
Historical obituaries from the 1970s may not be digitized or available online. Physical newspaper archives at Pasadena Public Library may have microfilm of Pasadena Star-News.

searches.parameters: "Archer L. Durham" OR "Archer Durham" obituary 2024 "Major General" USAF
searches.note: Search returned official Air Force biography and various military memorial pages, but no 2024 obituary. Air Force Times, Military Times, Air Commando Association, and other military organizations' memorial pages did not list an obituary.
FamilySearch California Death Index 1940-1997 (Collection 1932433) requires free account authentication to search. Unable to search without login.

SSDI free search sites (ssdi-search.com) have been hijacked or discontinued. SSDI now requires Ancestry.com subscription or FamilySearch authentication. SSDI would cover deaths 1936-2014 including Barney Durham (d. 1972-1974).
No newspaper articles about Archer L. Durham found in Pasadena News Index. He left Pasadena for military service in the 1950s and died in Maryland in 2024.

positive_search_results.note: Documenting successful searches that found records - critical for GPS compliance

searches.result: FOUND - 2 obituary citations for same person
searches.significance: MAJOR DISCOVERY - Confirms full name 'Barney Matthias Durham, Sr.', death date March 3, 1972, and existence of a Jr. Full obituary text available on microfilm at Pasadena Public Library.

searches.target: Barney Matthias Durham Jr. (newly discovered brother)
searches.significance: MAJOR DISCOVERY - Previously unknown brother of Archer L. Durham. Full obituary text available on microfilm at Pasadena Public Library.

research_gaps: No obituary found for Archer L. Durham (2024)
Mother Mattie Sorrell Durham death record not found
Sister Barbara Camille Durham death record not found
Paternal grandfather Archer Durham Sr. - no burial record found in NC
1950 Census ED 68-45 p.15 image needs manual transcription - AI only extracted Barney M. Durham, other family members may be on same page
Archer L. Durham (age 18 in 1950) not found in Pasadena 1950 Census - may have been at college or elsewhere
Barbara Camille Durham (age ~24 in 1950) not found - may have married and have different surname
Race should be verified from original census images when ruling out matches
Chronicling America newspaper search blocked by Cloudflare - try alternative access
african_american_research_resources: 1850/1860 Slave Schedules - for pre-Civil War ancestors
USCT (United States Colored Troops) Civil War records

free_resources_discovered.note: These resources provide free access to California death/obituary records WITHOUT login

resources.name: Pasadena News Index
resources.coverage: 1880s to present (primarily 1996-present, but includes older indexed material)
resources.content: Citation index to Pasadena Star-News, Pasadena Weekly, Pasadena Journal, and other local papers
resources.limitations: Index only - full text requires microfilm at Pasadena Public Library

resources.name: DeathIndexes.com California
resources.content: Directory of free California death record resources organized by county
resources.limitations: Directory only - links to various external resources

resources.name: NARA 1950 Census
resources.content: Searchable index with AI-extracted names and digitized images
resources.limitations: AI extraction may have errors; verify against original images
